definition: to become more urgent/more rapid/urgent/to handle a matter urgently
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Hello, file just received, and tomorrow I will send urgent in the past to you.
sentences.chinese: 你好，文件刚刚收到，明天我会加急寄过去给你。

sentences.english: He received an urgent announcement of victory at midnight.
If the cable is urgent, the rate will be doubled.
sentences.chinese: 如果是加急电报，费率加倍。

sentences.chinese: 他给记者拍了两份加急电报。

sentences.english: Generally, what percent of urgent charge you are willing to accept for quick-turn boards.

sentences.english: There is a special express service .

sentences.english: If youre in a hurry, we have a two-hour quick service.

sentences.english: Please note the deadline of each form. Surcharge must be paid for application overdue.

receipt (written acknowledgement of receipt of an item)
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
to send word/to deliver a letter
